title: 6 Classic Chinese Herbal Tea Drinks Explained & Where To Get Them in Hong Kong
author: Doris Lam
description: We're breaking down several popular Chinese herbal tea drinks for your next health fix, so you'll know exactly what to order.
cleaned_text: With this guide in hand, you'll know exactly what to order at Chinese herbal tea shops In China, herbs have been used as a way to [heal](https://hk.asiatatler.com/life/covid-mental-health), boost and [nourish the body](https://hk.asiatatler.com/dining/family-owned-chinese-restaurants-hong-kong) for centuries. Known as leung cha () in Cantonese, which translates to "cooling tea" in English, Chinese herbal teas are an essential part of Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) and have been believed to help prevent illnesses by minimising the body's excessive heat and dampness. Today, Chinese herbal teas still remain popular in Hong Kong, as it's believed that herbal teas act as a healthier, [natural alternative to Western medicine](https://hk.asiatatler.com/life/health-traditional-chinese-medicine-is-evolving). Whether you prefer to get your herbal tea fix from grab-and-go shops at the MTR station, or if you like old-school herbal tea shops that serve their magic potions in [ceramic bowls](https://hk.asiatatler.com/life/ceramics-tableware-kitchen), Chinese herbal teas can still feel daunting especially when you have no idea what each drink consists of or the benefits each one would bring. Here, we break down several popular Chinese herbal tea drinks for your next health fix. See also: [In Good Health: How Traditional Chinese Medicine Is Evolving In Leaps And Bounds](https://hk.asiatatler.com/life/health-traditional-chinese-medicine-is-evolving) 1. 24 Flavours () Function: Balances internal heat, aids digestion If you've been getting [pimples](https://hk.asiatatler.com/style/anti-acne-maskne-face-mask), sore throats and ulcers recently, it might be because you've been eating a lot of yeet hay () foods—meaning anything that is fried, greasy or spicy. To help balance out your body's heat, try 24 Flavours, one of the more well-known Chinese herbal tea drinks that aids with clearing internal heat and improves digestion issues. The drink is made of as many as 28 medicinal ingredients such as mulberry leaf, chrysanthemum flower and peppermint. Try it at: Good Spring Company, the TCM store that's located right by the SoHo escalators in Central. Opened in 1916, the store brews different herbal teas and sells them by the storefront. If you're looking for something more personalised, there are also TCM experts inside that are available for consultations.
